kernfrasen: Sin is a condition. It is a disease, an infection, that the whole human race has got.
there is no health in us
The whole world is held accountable to God.
God’s righteous sentence of death lies upon us all.
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: SIN IS A CRIME AND GOD IS THE JUDGE

kernfrasen: an actual Power, an alien and hostile force
I am captive to the law of sin
the wages of Sin is Death
I am the purchased slave of sin
God’s grace is absolutely free, but it is not cheap.
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: SIN IS DEBT/SLAVERY AND GRACE IS COSTLY REDEMPTION

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: Sin is a disease, an infection, that the whole human race has got.

cognitieve_implicaties: Sin is not just an act but a state of being.
One cannot simply 'stop' sinning through willpower.
theologische_implicaties: Total depravity; the need for an external Physician (Christ).
ethische_implicaties: Humility; recognition of shared human frailty.
onbedoelde_consequenties: May diminish personal agency or moral responsibility if viewed purely as a 'condition' one 'caught'.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher revitalizes the 'dead' liturgical phrase 'no health in us' by explicitly linking it to modern medical concepts of infection and systemic illness.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher successfully navigates between Sin as a 'Power' (Military) and Sin as a 'Condition' (Medical). The coherence is maintained by the overarching theme of 'Universal Accountability'.

incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: A disease is usually blameless (unfortunate), whereas a crime requires intent and responsibility.
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: If sin is an infection I 'got' from Adam, how am I 'accountable' as a criminal?

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The preacher uses the 'Lifeboat' to ground the 'Lost Sheep' metaphor in a high-stakes, modern survival scenario.

sterktes.beschrijving: Takes the 'dead' metaphor of the General Confession and gives it cognitive weight through the 'Lord of the Flies' illustration.
sterktes.voorbeeld: And who will rescue the adult and his cruiser?

risicos.beschrijving: The 'Wages of Sin' metaphor risks being read as a literal mechanical punishment.
risicos.voorbeeld: child who is hit by a truck were being punished for stealing a pack of gum
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation might view God as a petty executioner.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: A courtroom where the 'they' (the wicked) are being judged, only for the 'you' (the listener) to realize they are also in the dock.
sub_worlds: The desert island of Lord of the Flies

deictic_shifts.locatie: Transition to Lord of the Flies
deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: Highly effective at universalizing the concept of Sin.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: By emphasizing 'Wrath' as a steady, purposeful opposition to evil.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Perfectly aligns with the Episcopal General Confession, providing a cognitive 're-entry' into the liturgy.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the Medical and Military domains, portraying Sin as a systemic infection and an occupying Power. This effectively counters modern 'therapeutic' views of sin by making it more serious, though it occasionally creates tension with the Juridical domain of responsibility.

revitalisatie_suggesties.huidige_status: Often seen as 'un-Episcopal' or an emotional outburst.
revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Use the metaphor of 'Immune System Response'.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: God's wrath is like a healthy body's immune response to a deadly virus—it is not anger, but a necessary rejection of what destroys life.

coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Use the metaphor of 'Addiction'—it is both a disease and involves personal accountability/will.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: Suggests we are all victims of circumstance rather than rebels.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Clarify that we are the ones who poked holes in the boat.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To explain 'falling short of the glory' as a building missing its cornerstone or a bridge failing to reach the other side.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using CMT to bridge the gap between ancient text and modern psychology.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: Focuses on the cognitive mapping of 'Sin as Power' rather than the beauty of the prose.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Analyzes the conceptual structure of the message rather than the learning styles of the listeners.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: Reveals how the preacher uses the 'Container' schema (in/out of the reach of wrath) to dismantle the 'Inner Circle' schema of the religious elite.

appendices.notities: The sermon ends on a 'cliffhanger' (not turning the corner), which is a deliberate rhetorical strategy to leave the 'Sin' schema active in the hearer's mind.
